name: Justin Timberlake
description:
'''Justin Randall Timberlake''' (born January 31, 1981) is an American singer, songwriter, actor, record producer, and dancer. Dubbed the <nowiki>"</nowiki>[[Honorific nicknames in popular music|Prince of Pop]]<nowiki>"</nowiki>, he is an influential figure in [[popular music]]. Timberlake is one of the [[List of best-selling music artists|best-selling music artists]] of all time, with estimated sales of 88 million records worldwide.

Born and raised in [[Memphis, Tennessee]], Timberlake appeared on musical television shows as a child, competing on ''[[Star Search]]''; in the early to mid-1990s, he was a cast member on the [[Disney Channel]]'s ''[[The Mickey Mouse Club#1989–94 revival: The All-New Mickey Mouse Club|The All New Mickey Mouse Club]]'', where he performed cover songs, skits, and choreography. On the show, Timberlake met and worked with future bandmate [[JC Chasez]], and the two later rose to prominence as the [[lead vocalist]]s of the [[pop music|pop]] [[boy band]] [[NSYNC]]. The group released four commercially successful studio albums, becoming one of the [[best-selling]] boy bands of all time with sales of over 70 million units worldwide.

Timberlake established himself as a solo artist with his first two albums, ''[[Justified (album)|Justified]]'' (2002) and ''[[FutureSex/LoveSounds]]'' (2006), both of which sold over 10 million copies and received [[RIAA certification|triple platinum]] certifications by the [[RIAA]], with the latter became his first to debut atop the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]. His next three albums also peaked the chart as well: ''[[The 20/20 Experience]]'', ''[[The 20/20 Experience – 2 of 2]]'' (both 2013) and ''[[Man of the Woods]]'' (2018); the former became the [[List of best-selling albums by year in the United States|best-selling album of the year]]. Throughout his career, Timberlake scored numerous high-charting US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] singles, including "[[Cry Me a River (Justin Timberlake song)|Cry Me a River]]", "[[Rock Your Body]]", "[[SexyBack]]", "[[My Love (Justin Timberlake song)|My Love]]", "[[LoveStoned|LoveStoned/I Think She Knows]]", "[[What Goes Around... Comes Around]]", "[[Give It to Me (Timbaland song)|Give It to Me]]", "[[4 Minutes]]", "[[Pusher Love Girl]]", "[[Suit & Tie]]", "[[Mirrors (Justin Timberlake song)|Mirrors]]" and "[[Can't Stop the Feeling!]]", which earned him an [[Academy Award for Best Original Song|Academy Award]] nomination.

Timberlake enhanced his popularity with [[Justin Timberlake videography|an acting career]]. He landed starring roles in the films ''[[The Love Guru]]'' (2008), ''[[The Social Network]]'' (2010), ''[[Bad Teacher]]'' (2011), ''[[Friends with Benefits (film)|Friends with Benefits]]'' (2011), ''[[In Time]]'' (2011), ''[[Wonder Wheel (film)|Wonder Wheel]]'' (2017) and ''[[Palmer (film)|Palmer]]'' (2021). He also [[voice acting|voiced]] [[King Arthur|Artie]] in ''[[Shrek the Third]]'' (2007), [[Boo-Boo Bear]] in ''[[Yogi Bear (film)|Yogi Bear]]'' (2010) and Branch in the [[Trolls (franchise)|''Trolls'' franchise]] since 2016. ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' named him one of the [[Billboard's Greatest Pop Stars of the 21st Century|greatest pop stars of the 21st century]]. His [[List of awards and nominations received by Justin Timberlake|awards]] include ten [[Grammy Awards]], four [[Primetime Emmy Awards]], three [[Brit Awards]], nine [[Billboard Music Awards|''Billboard'' Music Awards]], the [[Songwriters Hall of Fame#Contemporary Icon Award|Contemporary Icon Award]] by the [[Songwriters Hall of Fame]], and [[MTV]]'s [[Michael Jackson Video Vanguard Award]]. He has frequently collaborated with producers such as [[The Neptunes]] and [[Timbaland]], who are best known for boosting Timberlake's solo career.
